description:
* Moving the INST_PY3 = 1 version of the mercurial install to before the first use of hg.

* Enabled Gadget Format 2 in _validate_header

* Changes in data_structures.py:
    1. New function to determine the gadget format:
    def _get_gadget_format(filename):
        # check and return gadget binary format
        f = open(filename, 'rb')
        (rhead,) = struct.unpack('<I',f.read(4))
        f.close()
        if (rhead == 134217728) | (rhead == 8):
            return 2
        elif (rhead == 65536) | (rhead == 256):
            return 1
        else:
            raise RuntimeError("Un correct Gadget format!")
    2. class GadgetBinaryFile(ParticleFile): add skip for the GF2 header
                if _get_gadget_format(filename) == 2:
                    f.seek(f.tell()+16)
    3. Function _get_hvals in class GadgetDataset: add skip for the GF2 header

    4. Function _validate_header in class GadgetDataset: add skip for the GF2 header
            elif rhead == 8:
                return True, '<'
            elif rhead == 134217728:
                return True, '>'

    Changes in io.py:
    1. from .data_structures import _get_gadget_format
    2. in class IOHandlerGadgetBinary(BaseIOHandler) __init__(): self._format =  _get_gadget_format(ds.parameter_filename)#default gadget format 1
    3. in _calculate_field_offsets:
                if self._format == 2:
                    pos += 20 #skip block header
                    #print("With Gadget format 2")
                elif self._format == 1:
                    pos += 4
                else:
                    raise RuntimeError("Un correct Gadget format!")
    		.....
                if (file_size != pos) & (self._format == 1): #ignore the rest of format 2
title: Stable-Add features to adopt the Gadget Format 2

pullrequest.title: Stable-Add features to adopt the Gadget Format 2

content.raw:
Hi @WeiguangCui. First, thanks so much for the pull request!

It looks like you made the changes on the stable branch. Unfortunately, we don't take pull requests on the stable branch so you're going to need to rebase your changes onto the yt branch. To make that easier, I've gone ahead and done that for you, all you need to do is close this pull request, pull the changes from me, push the rebased changes to your fork, and then reissue the pull request from the correct branch.

Here are the steps you need to complete:

* Decline this pull request, click the "decline" button at the top of this page.
* Execute the following mercurial commands:

```
$ hg pull -B weiguang-fix https://bitbucket.org/ngoldbaum/yt
$ hg update weiguang-fix
$ python setup.py develop
```

and re-test that your pull request is working.

* Push the rebased changes to your fork:

```
$ hg push -B weiguang-fix https://bitbucket.org/WeiguangCui/yt/
```

* Reissue the pull request from the rebased head. This new pull request should be from the `yt` branch in your fork  to the `yt` branch in the main repository. The `yt` branch is the name of the branch we use for active development.

I don't think anyone has actually looked at the code changes you made yet, so you might need to make additional changes or cleanups once people have reviewed your pull request. This is just what needs to happen so the tests can run and people can review your changes.

In addition, can you make a data file that is in the Gadget Format 2 style available so we can upload it to yt-project.org/data? In general, we'd like to have data files available for testing for all data formats that yt supports. That will also make it possible for people reviewing your PR to test it.

Finally, I think this is going to need some modifications to our documentation. The yt documentation is in the repository (the doc folder). I think at a minimum you're going to need to update the section on loading Gadget data (this page: http://yt-project.org/doc/examining/loading_data.html#gadget-data). The file you need to edit is located in the file, `doc/source/examining/loading_data.rst`, where this path is relative to the root of the yt repository.

Hope that's helpful, let us know if you have any questions about this.

Hi Weiguang Cui. First, thanks so much for the pull request!

It looks like you made the changes on the stable branch. Unfortunately, we don't take pull requests on the stable branch so you're going to need to rebase your changes onto the yt branch. To make that easier, I've gone ahead and done that for you, all you need to do is close this pull request, pull the changes from me, push the rebased changes to your fork, and then reissue the pull request from the correct branch.

Here are the steps you need to complete:

  • Decline this pull request, click the "decline" button at the top of this page.
  • Execute the following mercurial commands:
$ hg pull -B weiguang-fix https://bitbucket.org/ngoldbaum/yt
$ hg update weiguang-fix
$ python setup.py develop

and re-test that your pull request is working.

  • Push the rebased changes to your fork:
$ hg push -B weiguang-fix https://bitbucket.org/WeiguangCui/yt/
  • Reissue the pull request from the rebased head. This new pull request should be from the yt branch in your fork to the yt branch in the main repository. The yt branch is the name of the branch we use for active development.

I don't think anyone has actually looked at the code changes you made yet, so you might need to make additional changes or cleanups once people have reviewed your pull request. This is just what needs to happen so the tests can run and people can review your changes.

In addition, can you make a data file that is in the Gadget Format 2 style available so we can upload it to yt-project.org/data? In general, we'd like to have data files available for testing for all data formats that yt supports. That will also make it possible for people reviewing your PR to test it.

Finally, I think this is going to need some modifications to our documentation. The yt documentation is in the repository (the doc folder). I think at a minimum you're going to need to update the section on loading Gadget data (this page: http://yt-project.org/doc/examining/loading_data.html#gadget-data). The file you need to edit is located in the file, doc/source/examining/loading_data.rst, where this path is relative to the root of the yt repository.

Hope that's helpful, let us know if you have any questions about this.
